title: About
text:
Our Mission
To conduct cutting-edge research in microbiology that contributes to the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of infectious diseases. We aim to foster excellence in research and education while promoting collaboration with national and international institutions.

title: About
text:
Research Focus Areas

Bacterial Pathogenesis: Investigating mechanisms of bacterial infection and host-pathogen interactions
Antimicrobial Resistance: Studying the emergence and spread of antibiotic-resistant bacteria and developing strategies to combat resistance
Viral Infections: Researching viral diseases prevalent in Indonesia and Southeast Asia, including emerging infectious diseases
Mycology: Exploring fungal pathogens and their clinical significance
Molecular Microbiology: Utilizing molecular techniques to understand microbial genetics and evolution
Clinical Microbiology: Improving diagnostic methods and developing evidence-based treatment protocols

title: About
text:
Our Team
Our research group consists of dedicated faculty members, postdoctoral researchers, graduate students, and laboratory technicians. Each member brings unique expertise and contributes to our collaborative research environment.

title: About
text:
Facilities
We are equipped with state-of-the-art laboratories that support various aspects of microbiological research, including:

Biosafety Level 2 (BSL-2) laboratories for handling infectious agents
Molecular biology facilities for PCR, sequencing, and genetic analysis
Cell culture facilities for in vitro studies
Advanced microscopy equipment
Automated microbiology systems for clinical diagnostics

title: About
text:
Collaborations
We actively collaborate with leading institutions both nationally and internationally, including research centers, hospitals, and universities. These partnerships enable us to participate in multicenter studies and contribute to global health initiatives.

title: About
text:
Education and Training
We are committed to training the next generation of microbiologists through:

Supervision of undergraduate and graduate research projects
Workshops and training programs in microbiological techniques
Participation in national and international conferences
Mentorship programs for young researchers

title: About
text:
Contact Us
For more information about our research activities, collaboration opportunities, or educational programs, please contact us through the Faculty of Medicine, Universitas Indonesia.

title: Clinical Microbiology Research Group
text:
Universitas Indonesia
  
  
    
     Faculty of Medicine UI
  
  
    
     Email
  

  
  
The Microbiology Research Group at the Faculty of Medicine, Universitas Indonesia (FKUI) is dedicated to advancing knowledge in the field of microbiology through innovative research and education.





The Department of Clinical Microbiology at the Faculty of Medicine, Universitas Indonesia is organized into **five specialized research groups, each focused on critical areas of microbiology and infectious diseases. These multidisciplinary teams bring together experienced researchers, clinicians, and scientists who are dedicated to advancing knowledge through innovative research, clinical practice, and education.




Bacteriology and Antimicrobial Resistance-Integrated One Health
Emerging Microbes and Infectious Diseases
Virology and Pathobiology Cancer
Diagnosis and Therapy of Fungal Infection
Pathogenomic and Cellular Mycobacteria
